title: Example of r-selected species - spotted lanternfly

content.description: The spotted lanternfly is a herbivorous insect that is native to Asia and feeds on over <math alttext="70" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>70</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> species of plants. The feeding behavior of the spotted lanternfly damages plants, and the nymph and adult lanternflies secrete sticky residues that exacerbate the damage to native plant species by promoting mold growth. The spotted lanternfly reproduces once during its lifetime by laying between <math alttext="30" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> eggs, and the eggs hatch after a short amount of time. The range of the spotted lanternfly is increasing because the insects are transported to new environments by the movements of animals and people, and it is now found in many parts of the United States.
content.question: Which of the following best describes the spotted lanternfly in the United States?

choices.label: The spotted lanternfly is a <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected and invasive species.
The spotted lanternfly is a <math alttext="K" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected and endangered species.
The spotted lanternfly is an <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>r</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected and invasive species.
The spotted lanternfly is an <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>r</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected and endangered species.

content.answer: The spotted lanternfly is an <math alttext="r" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>r</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>-selected and invasive species.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Explain environmental concepts, processes, or models in applied contexts.
